subject: RE: [junit] Re: Future of testing tools
msgSnippet: I would get library errors during linking although all of the CppUnit code was in a CppUnit.dll file.  Other times it wouldn t find the directories even though
messageBody:
I would get library errors during linking although all of the CppUnit
code was in a CppUnit.dll file. Other times it wouldn't find the
directories even though I knew they were there. Then there were the
times it would pass. I'd refactor the code and it would fail. I would
put the code back the way I had it and the CppUnit tests would still
fail.

Maybe the problems stemmed from running CppUnit with Eclipse, mingw, on
Windows.

Dear Joel,

The list was of the tools represented by those present, not a
comprehensive list of testing tools. That would have taken the entire 90
minutes :-)

What were the problems you found with CppUnit?

Regards,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

Subject: [junit] Re: Future of testing tools

I noticed your map doesn't include CppUnit. I am not surprised as
running CppUnit (Eclipse on Windows with CDT) I found it too flaky to
count on. Is this because the group doesn't see C++ as a future
language? It might not be. I lobbied to use Real-Time Java instead of
C++, to no avail. Later, when it was too late to change, the project
manager told me Java would have been a better choice.

there was

a big
> issue for everyone.

> and dreams of users, so I thought I would open up the question here.
What is it
